_header: Jesu Lord for Thy holy circumcision
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Kalendar’ — fifty-one stanzas rhyme royal and concluding 8-line stanza (ababbcbc)

BodRawB408.First Lines:
O ihesu lorde for þi CircumsicyonIn þe begynnyng as of
                    þe new ȝere…
BodRawB408.Last Lines:
…Now saue us fader with oure flessh þy wordeffor Seynt
                    Siluester loue at oure laste ende
BodRawB408.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 363-76.
Clark,  Andrew,
                        ed.  
             The English Register of Godstow Nunnery… c. 1450.
             3 vols. 
             EETS
         o. s. 129 (1905; repr. 1971); 130 (1906; repr. with 142, 1971); 142
            (1911; repr. 1971): 13-24.

BodDou229.First Lines:
O ihesu lord for thi circumsisionIn the beginnynge of the newe
                    iere…
BodDou229.Last Lines:
…now saue us fadre with oute flech thi wordfor seint Siluester
                    loue atte ende last end

BodDou322.First Lines:
Ihesu lorde for thy holy CircumsicionIn the begynnyng of the newe
                    yere…
BodDou322.Last Lines:
…Now saue vs fader with thy flesshe thy wordeAnd that Seynt
                    Siluester be at oure last ende Amen
BodDou322.Attributed Title:
ffurst a kalendare of englyssh made in Balade by Dan John Lydegate Monke of
                    Bury (f. 1v); Thys ys a kelandare of englyssh made in Baladys by Dan
                    John lydegat Monke of Bury Whyche ys a fayre prayer And hit ys made after the
                    forme of a Compote Manuell (f. 7v)
BodDou322.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Nachträge zu den Legenden.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         80 (1888): 114-35: 114-35.

OxfStJohn340.First Lines:
With his blood Dauyd he did me weddepraie for me with
                    now with saynt Chadde…
OxfStJohn340.Last Lines:
…now graunt us lorde for thyne holy wordewith Siluester thy
                    blisse þat hathe none ende

BLHar1706.First Lines: Ihesu lorde for thy holy CyrcumsiciounIn the begynnyng of the newe yere…
BLHar1706.Last Lines: …Now saue vs fader with thy flessh thy wordeAnd that seynt Syluester be at oure last ende
BLHar1706.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 1706.

BLHar1706.Editions:
Maskell,  William. 
             Monumenta Ritualia Ecclesiae Anglicanae.
         3 vols. London: Pickering, 1846-47; 2nd ed. 1882: 3.224-5 (rev. ed.; selections).

BLHar4011.First Lines:
…With his bloode Savid he did me weddePray for me now Seint
                    Chedde…
BLHar4011.Last Lines:
…Now save me fadir with thi wordeAnd Seint Siluestre at my
                    last ende
BLHar4011.Note:
Lacks lines 1-59; rubric ‘Amen’ at end of last
                    line.

Lam878.First Lines:
Ihesu for thi holi CircumcisionIn the beginning of the new
                    yereSaue and kepe me fro confusionWhanne I shall stonde at my
                    answere…
Lam878.Last Lines:
…Þat we mauy sit at Innocentis bordeWith sent Thomas
                        of Caunterburi oure frendeNow kepe us Ihesu fro þe
                    fendeWith sent siluester at oure last endeAmen
Lam878.Note:
Reference to St. Thomas rubbed out. Names of saints, etc. in
                    rubric.

Longleat30.First Lines:
Ihesu lord fo þi holy CircumcisionIn þe bigynnynge of
                    þe newe yere
Longleat30.Last Lines:
Now saue vs fader with our flessch þi wordeffor seint siluester
                    at oure last eende Amen

HunHM142.First Lines:
Ihesu lord for thi holy CircumsicionIn the bigynnyng of þe
                    newe yere…
HunHM142.Last Lines:

                    Siluester at owre laste eende
